title: 旧约 - 约伯记(Job) - 第 22 章
subTitle: 旧约 -- 约伯记(Job) -- 第 22 章 ( 本篇共有 42 章 )

lineList.en: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
lineList.cn: 毯螅人以利法回答说，

lineList.en: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
lineList.cn: 人岂能使神有益呢。智慧人但能有益于己。

lineList.en: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
lineList.cn: 你为人公义，岂叫全能者喜悦呢。你行为完全，岂能使他得利呢。

lineList.en: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
lineList.cn: 岂是因你敬畏他，就责备你，审判你吗。

lineList.en: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
lineList.cn: 你的罪恶岂不是大吗。你的罪孽也没有穷尽。

lineList.en: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
lineList.cn: 因你无故强取弟兄的物为当头，剥去贫寒人的衣服。

lineList.en: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
lineList.cn: 困乏的人，你没有给他水喝。饥饿的人，你没有给他食物。

lineList.en: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
lineList.cn: 有能力的人就得地土。尊贵的人也住在其中。

lineList.en: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
lineList.cn: 你打发寡妇空手回去，折断孤儿的膀臂。

lineList.en: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
lineList.cn: 因此，有网罗环绕你，有恐惧忽然使你惊惶。

lineList.en: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
lineList.cn: 或有黑暗蒙蔽你，并有洪水淹没你。

lineList.en: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
lineList.cn: 神岂不是在高天吗。你看星宿何其高呢。

lineList.en: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
lineList.cn: 你说，神知道什么。他岂能看透幽暗施行审判呢。

lineList.en: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
lineList.cn: 密云将他遮盖，使他不能看见。他周游穹苍。

lineList.en: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
lineList.cn: 你要依从上古的道吗。这道是恶人所行的。

lineList.en: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
lineList.cn: 他们未到死期，忽然除灭。根基毁坏，好像被江河冲去。

lineList.en: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
lineList.cn: 他们向神说，离开我们吧。又说，全能者能把我们怎吗样呢。

lineList.en: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
lineList.cn: 那知，神以美物充满他们的房屋。但恶人所谋定的离我好远。

lineList.en: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
lineList.cn: 义人看见他们的结局就欢喜。无辜的人嗤笑他们。

lineList.en: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
lineList.cn: 说，那起来攻击我们的果然被剪除，其馀的都被火烧灭。

lineList.en: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
lineList.cn: 你若认识神，就得平安。福气也必临到你。

lineList.en: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
lineList.cn: 你当领受他口中的教训，将他的言语存在心里。

lineList.en: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
lineList.cn: 你若向全能者，从你帐棚中远除不义，就必得建立。

lineList.en: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
lineList.cn: 要将你的珍宝丢在尘土里，将俄斐的黄金丢在溪河石头之间。

lineList.en: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
lineList.cn: 全能者就必为你的珍宝，作你的宝银。

lineList.en: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
lineList.cn: 你就要以全能者为喜乐，向神仰起脸来。

lineList.en: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
lineList.cn: 你要祷告他，他就听你。你也要还你的愿。

lineList.en: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
lineList.cn: 你定意要作何事，必然给你成就。亮光也必照耀你的路。

lineList.en: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
lineList.cn: 人使你降卑，你仍可说，必得高升。谦卑的人神必拯救。

lineList.en: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
lineList.cn: 人非无辜，神且要搭救他。他因你手中清洁，必蒙拯救。
